sentences.english: I asked my colleague you in that school? He said that in.
sentences.chinese: 我问我同事你在那上学呢？他说在，电大。

sentences.english: My acquaintance confirmed that his fellow postmen were neither terribly nice nor terribly nasty.
sentences.chinese: 我这位熟人证明，他的同事们既不太好，也不太差。

sentences.english: His escapades are well-known by his associates.
sentences.chinese: 他的劣行败迹，素为同事们所周知。

sentences.english: Dear colleagues, a pleasant journey, I remember thinking of us, always come back together sometime.
sentences.chinese: 亲爱的同事，一路顺风，记得想念我们，常回来聚聚。

sentences.english: Buddies can be co-workers, family members, friends.
sentences.chinese: 同伴可以是同事，家人或者朋友。

sentences.english: Thirty-six percent of singles would consider dating someone in the workplace.
sentences.chinese: 36%的单身者会考虑与同事约会。

sentences.english: The other day a colleague commented that he enjoyed listening to my musical efforts.
sentences.chinese: 有一天，有个同事说他喜欢听我讲为音乐付出的努力。

sentences.english: He would notify colleagues before he stepped out to the water cooler.
sentences.chinese: 他出去到冷水机前都会告诉同事。

sentences.english: Do you click well with your colleagues and boss?
sentences.chinese: 你和同事上司相处得融洽吗？

sentences.english: One of the first things that your supervisor may do is to introduce you to co-workers.
sentences.chinese: 你的上级首先可能做的事情之一是把你介绍给同事。

sentences.english: Your clients and colleagues don't have time to engage fully with every email they get.
sentences.chinese: 你的客户和同事没时间仔细看完收到的每封电子邮件。

sentences.english: One of his colleagues was murdered 11 years ago by Guangdong gangsters.
sentences.chinese: 他的一个同事11年前被广东的歹徒谋杀。

sentences.english: Martin teamed up with a colleague to write the report.
sentences.chinese: 马丁和一个同事共同写这份报告。

sentences.english: Colleague: In that case, all of us can make the progress at the same time.
sentences.chinese: 同事:如果那样的话，我们就能共同进步了。

sentences.english: When Jim died, one of his colleagues telephoned with the news.
sentences.chinese: 吉姆的死讯是他的同事打电话告知的。

definition: a relative (i.e. family relation)/CL:門|门[men2],個|个[ge4],位[wei4]
to study at the same school/fellow student/classmate/CL:位[wei4],個|个[ge4]
(coll.) (a woman's) close female friend/bestie/(originally written 閨密|闺密, an abbr. for 閨中密友|闺中密友)
variant of 老闆|老板[lao3 ban3]
to go to work/to be on duty/to start work/to go to the office
(dialect) close childhood friend whom one grew up with/a couple who grew up as childhood friends
